text: Roeland Park is a city in Johnson County, Kansas, United States. It is part of the Kansas City metropolitan area. In 2020, 6,871 people lived there. ==Geography== Roeland Park is at (39.034705, âˆ’94.639211). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it land. ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 6,871 people, 3,201 households, and 1,740 families living in Roeland Park. Of the households, 71.8% owned their home and 28.2% rented their home. The median age was 34.5 years. Of the people, 80.5% were White, 3.7% were Black, 2.0% were Asian, 0.4% were Native American, 0.2% were Pacific Islanders, 4.0% were from some other race, and 9.2% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 12.0% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 6,731 people, 3,065 households, and 1,732 families living in Roeland Park. ==Education== The city is part of the Shawnee Mission School District. Roesland Elementary School, St. Agnes Elementary School and Bishop Miege High School are in Roeland Park. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * City of Roeland Park * Roeland Park - Directory of Public Officials ;Maps * Roeland Park City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Johnson County, Kansas
title: Roeland Park, Kansas
